posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.27 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here . If you’d like to get releases even faster, try out Obtainium!

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

No new notes, but we did add the ability to rename a linked device. Try it out!

Complete list of new commits since 7.26.1
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.26.1…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.26 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.27.0 (149000)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

53 new commits since 7.26.1:

Show commits

  • Update backup integration tests. [1]

  • Add new rules to log scrubber. [2]

  • Potential fix for a backup validation error. [3]

  • Force relays only if remote user is not a 'Signal Connection'. [4]

  • Add "your media will be deleted today" mechanism based off last checkin time and media TTL. [5]

  • Remove orphaned attachments when creating a new backup. [6]

  • Add sgnl://ideal support to app deeplinks. [7]

  • Add unit test for RegistrationUtil. [8]

  • Use AEP for regv3 flows. [9]

  • Fix creating message_fts table during database migration. [10]

    Fixes #13034
    Fixes #13506

  • Rebuild FTS index in V239_MessageFullTextSearchEmojiSupport. [11]

  • Rebuild FTS index in V242_MessageFullTextSearchEmojiSupportV2. [12]

    Resolves #13810

  • Fix multiple activity finish after donation. [13]

  • Fix icon gradient. [14]

  • Use ChatListener to get connection interrupted event from libsignal; clear connection state when received [15]

  • Flesh out restore paths for regv3. [16]

  • Update to libsignal 0.63.0 [17]

  • Add an internal sqlite playground. [18]

  • Update linked devices strings. [19]

  • Allow renaming of linked device. [20]

  • Fix export bugs causing validation errors. [21]

  • Update GV2 spinner transformer to for group updates in message extras. [22]

  • Improve storage service diff logging. [23]

  • Remove some unnecessary call tab requeries. [24]

  • Verify group ids on peer-to-peer group changes. [25]

  • Inject SignalWebSocket into IncomingMessageObserver. [26]

    Resolves #13820

  • Use calling service type for calls. [27]

  • Kotlin-ize some more tests. [28]

    Resolves #13813

  • Fix empty username backupv2 export. [29]

  • Fix lost voice notes on orientation change. [30]

  • Allow group removal shortcut in chat folders. [31]

  • Use EmojiTextView for chat folder names. [32]

  • Center call link button. [33]

  • Add validation error UI. [34]

  • Split remote user check for group vs individual calls. [35]

  • Ensure updateMessageRequestAcceptedState runs on main thread. [36]

  • Convert more tests to kotlin. [37]

    Resolves #13825

  • Update most of the backup integration tests. [38]

  • Add some more link+sync logs. [39]

  • Use AEP when validating backup. [40]

  • Fix incorrect ACI/PNI storage for revoked invites in group updates. [41]

  • Fix denial dialog for call links. [42]

  • Handle web socket closed unexpectedly errors more gracefully. [43]

  • Inline the expireVersion capability. [44]

  • Inline the deleteSync capability. [45]

  • Fix calls silent ringer bug. [46]

  • Fix GSE crash when attempting to send to non-GV2 groups. [47]

  • Update to the latest backup tests. [48]

  • Add call link strings. [49]

  • Add sms provider failed specific messaging during registration. [50]

  • Better progress messaging. [51]

  • Update translations and other static files. [52]

  • Bump version to 7.27.0 [53]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.26.1…v7.27.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked: The windows version of aapt2-8.4.1-11315950 is still missing in verification-metadata.xml.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: It seems that the loading on the calls tab has slightly improved but still takes a while for me. :(

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: Not sure about this beta, but i tried deleting all calls from the calls tab… eternity isn’t long enough

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked: I just deleted 118 calls from Call Tabs. No problems.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: Maybe an index was added

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: debug log is your friend

How can you only delete 118 calls?? If I delete all, it would be thousands. Only from the last months there already several hundreds. That’s probably the reason why it is slow to change to the calls tab (all are loaded at once? no, only the first 15 or so).

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked: I had only 118 calls.
You all make a lot of calls . I have 50 calls on Signal since September last year. At least 10 of those were butt dials .
I use Signal for work and have a lot of calls with clients. That is why I donate monthly. I need it to work seamlessly.

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Whatnoww:

It seems that the loading on the calls tab has slightly improved but still takes a while for me. :(

Found some unnecessary re-queries I was able to remove. The core issue remains that he query itself is slow, even with indices. It’s doing a lot of stuff to de-dupe and cluster related calls.

I have an idea for drastically improving it, it’s just gonna take me a lot of time to understand it well enough to make the change (the existing query is very complex), and I’m crunched for time at the moment. But hopefully soon!

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
erik55:

I use Signal for work and have a lot of calls with clients. That is why I donate monthly. I need it to work seamlessly.

Signal has almost entirely replaced normal phone calls for me, so I also have a constant influx of daily calls using it.

greyson-signal:

I have an idea for drastically improving it, it’s just gonna take me a lot of time to understand it well enough to make the change (the existing query is very complex), and I’m crunched for time at the moment. But hopefully soon!

Wohoo!! Great to hear there are good improvements incoming :)

  • Update translations and other static files. [2]

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution

posts.name: Golden Dragonfly
posts.cooked:
I found 3 bugs.

  1. If only the participant video is on. Try to see the participant video in full screen. The lower screen does not fill. Continue like this.

    Screenshot_20241207_Signal1080×2340 119 KB

    Until you minimize and maximize or move to PIP, then full screen.

  2. If I’m on an audio call and the signal is PIP, and if the participants switches on their camera. Doesn’t appear on my side till I switch to full screen.

  3. If the signal is in PIP and the participant ends the call. The signal stays on pip, as if the call is still active. Until I manually switch to full screen or click the ‘X’ button on PIP.

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
Sharing media into Signal from another app fails to work:

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.27.0/784cdbddaa622d7bc80bd6f869e04c89b0df4586fd3ebbc02bba6f2a9bc16947

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Sharing some logs related to call tab loading in case it’s useful.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.27.1/6ee8cdbedce6f6c65148179a30c73d7fc2e0a4299763c3d0e77a79380e34fbaf

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: This does not seem likely until backups are released

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Audio sent from iOS is not audible. I share from voice notes to Signal and I can’t hear anything.

1733960649322

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.27.1/c7ce6be87509abef307f8490952d6e1081eb2d0c422aca0ce74bbcf378578276

Additionally, iOS displays the file name when it is available above the audio message while Android doesn’t. I find this to be extremely useful. While the file name is of course unnecessary while sending a normal voice message, if you’re sending a file seeing the file name can provide important information.

Also, when taking the debug log this time, the link only occupied one line and trailed off into “…” instead of displaying the entire link on multiple lines like it usually should.

Can y’all please add the OnePlus Watch 2 to the blacklist for audio devices please? It never works in calls when selecting it as a source :(
